newsitem.title: CHINA: HUTCHISON SAYS IN JAPAN PROPERTY JV.
newsitem.headline: HUTCHISON SAYS IN JAPAN PROPERTY JV.

text.p: Hutchison Whampoa Ltd and Pacific Century Group said on Wednesday they have formed a joint venture in a property development project in Japan.
Pacific Century Group, a private company controlled by Richard Li, son of Hutchison chairman Li Ka-shing, would have a 55 percent stake in the joint venture, they said in a statement.
Hutchison would hold the remaining 45 percent stake for approximately 21.6 billion yen (HK$1.45 billion).
The joint venture would finance, develop and own a 52,250 sq foot prime commerical site in the Marunochi district of Tokyo, Japan.
They said Pacific Century Group bought the Tokyo property for 86.89 billion yen (HK$5.82 billion).
